abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines shortcomings of up to a dozen New York City Council proposed bills that address flaws in campaign finance laws; notes that bills might allow individual Council members freedom to pocket monetary benefits.

headline.print_headline: Improvements (and ‘Goodies’) May Be Coming to City’s Campaign Finance Laws
headline.main: Behind Closed Doors, Measures to Reform City’s Campaign Laws Raise Concerns

snippet: With as many as 12 bills in the works, the City Council’s efforts to reform campaign finance laws have some worried that the changes might come at a cost....
lead_paragraph: With as many as 12 bills in the works, the City Council’s efforts to reform campaign finance laws have some worried that the changes might come at a cost.
